title: How to get deep rich colors in photography - Quora

response.answer_text: Q - How do you get deep rich colors in photography? A - For sunsets (and dawns) you can get deep rich colors best by not over exposing. I photograph a lot of sunsets and as I run photo contests for a coast side community, I see a lot of sunset photos by others. The number #2 problem is over exposure (#1 is horizons not level). If you have over exposed there is little that can be done. Do an experiment. Take a photo of a sunset normally. Now repeat (use manual mode) one stop down. And again, and again until you have underexposed what the camera thinks is the right exposure by maybe 5 stops. See what comes out best with your camera. Also adding more contrast can help. I became tired years ago of people asking me if I added Saturation in post-processing step. I never use Saturation in sunsets. It isn’t needed and does not look natural. Have fun!

Longer exposure and raise iso to the desired setting. Timing and proper settings make perfection. Practice makes things better. The other part is using a camera that shoots RAW and you get more color after post processing in Lightroom, etc. which camera are you working with?
